answerText: carrying capacity [prompt on K][10] This type of selection sees the population booms and then busts rapidly after the carrying capacity is exceeded. It is contrasted with k-selection.

subject: Science
question: Question: For a population P under a logistic model, this is the K in dP/dt = cP times 1 Â– P/K. For 10 points each: [10] Name this concept, the maximum size of a population that its habitat can support over time. It is often represented as the uppermost horizontal asymptote in a graph of population versus time.
